question:
Which of the following statements is/are correct regarding Multi Layered plastics which was recently seen in news?
  1. These are non-recyclable, non-energy recoverable, and have no alternative uses
  2. Government has recently issued a notification to phase out multi-layered plastics
Select the correct option form the codes given below:
explanation: Statement 1 is correct: MLPs are non-recyclable, non-energy recoverable, and have no alternative uses, and are hence a critical threat to the ecosystem. The same amendment issued the prescription of a central system which will carry the names of producers, brand-owners and importers. This will allow agencies to better track and control the usage of plastics. Mostly, MLP packets have two sheets of plastic enclosing a layer of aluminium, but technically MLP can be any material that has at least one layer of plastic. Statement 2 is correct: The Environment Ministry in a new notification has amended the rules of plastic waste management, and suggested the phasing-out of multi-layered plastics (MLP), the shiny plastic material which is used to package chips, biscuit and ready-to-eat food products.
